intro: Dictyocline griffithii var. pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dictyocline, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, pinnately divided leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understoreys. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
